intro: Eriogonum corymbosum var. revealianum, commonly known as the Revealian’s buckwheat, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Polygonaceae family and is characterized by its dense, mat-forming growth habit. The plant produces clusters of small, white to pale pink flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are typically gray-green with a fuzzy texture, and it thrives in well-drained, sandy soils. This variety is often found in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes.
